page.title: 16INDUSTRY IN THE HARBOUR AREA
page.content: MOST INDUSTRY IN BUCKIE IS LOCATED IN THE HARBOUR AREA OR AT MARCH ROAD, ON THE EASTERN OUTSKIRTS OF THE TOWN, WHERE THERE IS AN INDUSTRIAL ESTATE. PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT EMPLOYERS IN THE HARBOUR AREA ARE THREE BOATYARDS WHICH BUILD MAINLY FISHING CRAFT. THE YARDS ARE THOMSON'S, JONES SHIPYARD AND HERD AND MACKENZIES'S. MORAY SEAFOODS OWNED AND FOUNDED BY MR CHARLES EKERSLEY IS AN IMPORTANT EMPLOYER AND EXPORTS SHELLFISH PRODUCTS TO SOUTHERN EUROPE. A FLEET OF LARGE REFRIGERATED VEHICLES ARE USED TO TRANSPORT THE HIGH QUALITY PRODUCT TO THE CONTINENT. MORAY SEAFOODS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT AS AN EMPLOYER OF WOMEN AND GIRLS. HAMILTON BROTHERS ARE ANOTHER IMPORTANT FIRM IN THE HARBOUR AREA.
